chapter.title: Calculating Converts
chapter.subtitle: גרים גרורים - Gerim Gerurim
chapter.para: Element of selfish gain for only their animal soul. As opposed to an element of fear of losing the life of one's animal soul like gerim ariyot from a previous chapter.
Gerim of Mordecai and Esther are most likely Gerim Gerurim.
The etymology of the word from the etymological dictionary - gerar means to chew cud. A pig doesn't gerar. See conversation with Jake Fry.

Gerim Gerurim come for selfish motives and attach to Yisrael when the hand of Yisrael is strong. This is explained in Avodah Zarah 2b which is before the war of Gog u'Magog. During the war, these gerim gerurim will break the mitzvot they were keeping and cast them away. There will be a remnant of these gerim, however, that will still keep the mitzvot and haShem will make them and their language pure and all will call upon the name of haShem and serve him in oneness. This is explained in Berakhot 57a and the commentary on Zephaniah 3:9 by RADAK which shows the goyim returning to haShem and becoming gerim.
The people who will remain after the war of Gog in their first language will make it clear to them that they will not utter another God in their language, but all will call in the name of the Lord. This is a clear language as he said in the prophecy of Zechariah on that day there will be one God and His name is one. Will turn into worshiping God alone in a clear language is the language of holiness in which alone is called the honorable name - RADAK on Zephaniah 3:9
